item.title: The Great Awokening ft. Josh Daws [Open Mike with Michael Thiessen]
item.description:
OPEN MIKE w/Michael Thiessen ~ June 14, 2024
On this episode of Open Mike with Michael Thiessen, Dr. Thiessen sits down with writer and podcaster Josh Daws to explore the concept of 'wokeness' in churches across North America. It delves into the definition of wokeness and how it has evolved from an awareness of systemic injustice to encompassing the Marxist ideas undergirding Critical Race Theory.

The discussion highlights the shift from biblical justice to a needs-based view of justice and the dangers of redefining terms like justice and oppression. It also touches on the impact of critical theory on the church, the focus on social justice over preaching the gospel, and the division created by constantly defining new oppressed groups. Concrete examples are given, including the MLK 50 event and the push for 'kingdom diversity' in churches. The conversation explores the importance of charity and the divide among Christian leaders. They discuss the need to distinguish between those pushing harmful agendas and those who are hurting and in need of care. They also touch on the cultural shifts and the challenges faced by the church in the current climate. The conversation concludes with a discussion on Twitter algorithms and the future of dialogue.

item.title: Did Al Mohler Make a Metaphysical Misstatement about the November Elections? [God, Law, and Liberty]
item.description: Dr. Al Mohler said this week that there will be  “two rival understandings of reality facing off” in the November elections. Is that true?  David asks and answers several questions about the nature of law that probe the accuracy of Mohler’s assessment. More importantly, is there evidence that evangelical Christianity doesn’t even present a rival understanding of reality to that held by the Democratic and Republican parties.

item.title: Ep. 106: Queer Politics with Joy Pullmann [The Outstanding Podcast]
item.description:
The best trick the devil ever played was to make people believe that he doesn’t exist. Host Joseph Backholm is joined by the executive editor of the Federalist and author of, “False Flag: Why Queer Politics Mean the End of America” for an in-depth discussion on queer politics. In her new book, Joy unpacks the definition of queer politics and the negative impact it is currently having on American society and government. She warns that this ideology erases rights, harms families, and mocks Christianity. She offers further analysis into the actual intent of the founders of this movement and the alarming level of naivety we see in our culture toward this harmful ideology.

Resources

  • False Flag: Why Queer Politics Mean the End of America by Joy Pullmann

item.title: Lucky Forest, North Korea, and Being Arrested as a Spy [China Compass]
item.description:
Welcome to the China Compass Podcast!

Today we start with an article about an LGBT Taiwanese arrested (rightfully) in China (2:10), and how China sometimes does the right thing (for the wrong reasons), including persecuting cults…

https://www.voanews.com/amp/detention-of-two-taiwanese-in-china-sparks-concern-about-personal-safety/7651055.html

Next we look at the long-standing frustration of foreigners being forbidden from most Chinese hotels (9:38). 

https://www.ft.com/content/bd2ea766-21f0-436d-b32b-26f8be640052 (Paywall)

Then a couple articles about North Korean trash balloons (13:09), which leads us into discussion of our adopted province of the day, Lucky Forest (Jilin), which shares a long border with North Korea (15:24).

https://abcnews.go.com/amp/International/wireStory/north-korea-resumes-flying-balloons-bid-drop-trash-110954597

https://www.hawaiitribune-herald.com/2024/06/11/nation-world-news/seoul-activists-develop-smart-balloons-to-send-messages-deep-into-north-korea/

CCP is brought to you by Pray for China: https://prayforchina.us/ Find your province to pray for today!

After an overview of beautiful Jilin (16:25), it is story time (21:54). I share about my one and only visit to a Christian hotel in China, followed by my account of being detained along the North Korean border as a suspected spy.

Get daily prayer reminders on Instagram or X: @chinaadventures

Here's the one for today, which paired up perfectly with today's Jilin focus...

June 13 - Pray for Tonghua, which borders North Korea in NE China’s Jilin Province.

I spent a few days here back in the summer of 2003, which I remember esp. for the “Christian Hotel” I stumbled upon in the town of Meihekou, where all the workers were reading their Bibles!

Jilin (Literally: Lucky Forest) is paired up with all 6 New England states for prayer: www.PrayforChina.us

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tonghua

https://www.asiaharvest.org/china-resources/jilin

#prayforchina

item.title: 158: Overlooked Emotional Sins: Fear [Leadership Now Podcast]
item.description:
In this week's episode, we continue in our series on 'overlooked emotional sins', as we cover the sin of fear. How does fear differ from anxiety? What are the most common things our society is fearful of today? What are the consequences of fear and how can you relieve it from your life? Tune in for all of those answers and more!

item.title: CANADA is a CORRUPT, COVETOUS, COMMUNIST COUNTRY [Liberty Dispatch]
item.description:
Liberty Dispatch ~ June 13, 2024
On this episode of Liberty Dispatch, Andrew and Matty get you up-to-date on the recent news coming out of Canada, as well as examining Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland's recent presser, which exposes the Trudeau Regime as the corrupt, covetous, Communist Regime that is truly is. 

Segment 1 - News Brief:
"Prolonged grief in children and adolescents" | Acta Paediatrica https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/apa.17309;
"Pro-LGBT Group Attempts to Cancel Massive Canadian Evangelical Christian Event" | LifeSiteNews https://www.lifesitenews.com/news/pro-lgbt-group-attempts-to-cancel-massive-canadian-evangelical-christian-event;
"Canadian Cancer Society Apologizes for Using 'Cervix' Instead of 'Front Hole' for LGBTQ Community" | Toronto Sun https://torontosun.com/news/national/canadian-cancer-society-sorry-for-using-cervix-instead-of-front-hole-for-lgbtq-community;
"Veteran Pro-Lifer Linda Gibbons Arrested Outside Toronto Abortion Mill for Second Time in 8 Days" | LifeSiteNews https://www.lifesitenews.com/news/veteran-pro-lifer-linda-gibbons-arrested-outside-toronto-abortion-mill-for-second-time-in-8-days;
"Toronto Police End Unauthorized Encampment at York University" | National Post https://nationalpost.com/news/canada/toronto-police-end-unauthorized-encampment-at-york-university;
"Bank of Canada Issues $23 Million in Bonuses in 2023" | Taxpayer https://www.taxpayer.com/newsroom/bank-of-canada-issues-23-million-in-bonuses-in-2023;

Segment 2 - Chystia Freeland and 21-Century Soft Communism:
"Freeland Warns of Dark Future Without Capital Gains Tax Hike" | Toronto Sun https://torontosun.com/opinion/columnists/freeland-warns-of-dark-future-without-capital-gains-tax-hike;
"Tweet by Stephen Taylor" | Twitter https://x.com/stephen_taylor/status/1800139536028291277

Segment 3 - Is Europe Fed-up with Socialism:
"Macron Trounced by Le Pen’s Populists at EuroParl Elections, Immediately Dissolves Parliament for Snap National Election" | Breitbart https://www.breitbart.com/europe/2024/06/09/macron-trounced-by-le-pens-populists-at-europarl-elections-immediately-dissolves-parliament-for-snap-national-election.

item.title: Ep. 105: PRIDE Goeth Before the Fall Month with Rosaria Butterfield [The Outstanding Podcast]
item.description:
Pride is an idol and the rainbow is their god. Should Christians see Pride as a religion? Host Joseph Backholm is joined by author and professor, Rosaria Butterfield for a high level overview of Pride. Rosaria, a former lesbian and LGBT activist, shares her unique perspective on the evolution of the pride movement, how Pride became the idol of our day, and what caused the push of “gay is good”. She offers a biblical perspective, rooted in scripture, on how homosexuality is attacking the created order and creating a highly worshipped idol.

Resources

  • ⁠Ep. 55: Rosaria Butterfield and Five Lies of Our Anti-Christian Age⁠
  • ⁠Ep. 56: Rosaria Butterfield: An Unlikely Convert⁠

 

Read ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠The Washington Stand⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠, featuring news and commentary from a biblical worldview. item.description:
This week Greg sat down with Andrew Crapuchettes. Andrew is an entrepreneur, tech innovator, and  the CEO of RedBalloon; a labor placement company.  They discussed how christians can navigate a secular workplace, why corporations choose to be woke against their customers wishes, and what the christian strategy should be in the coming decades. Andrew also stuck around for a "Fresh 10" segment, and he gave one of the best answers we've ever gotten on the podcast. Enjoy!

item.title: How to Win the World, Part 2: War with Worship with Doug Wilson [The Ezra Institute Podcast for Cultural Reformation]
item.description:
The Ezra Institute brings you a new series with the Rebels when P Nate and Pootie are joined by a variety of guests talking about several key practical outworkings of theological concepts that will help Christians expand the Kingdom of God, see the dark pushed back, and slowly (like leaven working through the loaf) win the world.

In this episode, P Nate and Pootie invite Doug Wilson onto the show to discuss an unlikely place for world-conquering to start... with corporate worship. Wilson lays out a vision of worship that extends from the corporate gathering of local churches to the private practices of every Christian behind closed doors. If we want to win the world, we need to start with proper worship... because, in the Christian worldview, worship is warfare!

item.title: TCND: Testimonies for Everyone! (Gospel of Psychology) [The Comedian Next Door]
item.description:
Hey, Neighbor! 

Luke's microphone isn't switched on, and it distracts us from sharing all the intricate Baby Details.  But--rest assured--Tabby had her baby.  

While the Peaches was supporting the birthing mother, Juan and John and Luke were attending the Christian Comedy Association Conference.  There were some very encouraging testimonies shared during that time.  Luke wonders if churches should make space for MORE testimonies to be shared on Sunday mornings...

Later: Why does the word "psychology" keep getting used as a synonym for "spirituality?"  Are they one in the same concept?

Contact the Comedian's family by emailing nextdoor@johnbranyan.com

item.title: Ben Merkle, Tom Price, and what they Learned about Learning at Oxford [The Pugcast]
item.description: Today begins the first of the shows recorded in Oxford! Today Tom and Chris are joined by Dr. Ben Merkle, President of New Saint Andrews College. Ben was visiting Oxford at the same time as the Pugs, and this afforded an opportunity to discuss with Tom and Chris what Ben learned at Oxford about post-secondary education and how those lessons are being applied at New Saint Andrews College half a world away.
item.author: FLF, LLC

item.title: Taking the Marx Out of Marketing ft. Craig Klein of Sales Nexus [Open Mike with Michael Thiessen]
item.description:
OPEN MIKE w/Michael Thiessen ~ June 07, 2024
On this episode of Open Mike, Dr. Thiessen is joined by Craig Klein, CEO/President of SalesNexus. Their conversation covers the topics of censorship, cancel culture, and the impact on conservative voices in the business world. It delves into the challenges faced by organizations in reaching their audience and the role of technology platforms in censoring content. The discussion also explores the intersection of business and Christian values and the need for a more transparent and ethical approach to content moderation. The conversation delves into the impact of the Christian worldview on business, the issue of censorship, and the importance of localism and technological expertise in navigating big tech challenges. It emphasizes the need for intentional support of Christian businesses and the protection of data and messaging integrity.

item.title: Ep. 104: The Long Term Effects of Pride with Walt Heyer [The Outstanding Podcast]
item.description:
There is no pot of gold at the end of the Pride rainbow. Host Joseph Backholm is joined by Family Research Council’s Walt Heyer for a discussion on the long-term effects of Pride and to unpack the exponential growth of those who identify as LGBTQ. What is the draw of identifying as LGBTQ? Is it the sense of community? How many are choosing this lifestyle deliberately in defiance of God? Speaking from his personal experience, Walt weighs on how Christians should respond to Pride, why the “T” should be taken out of LGBTQ, and the difference between gay Pride and Pride.

Resources

  • Walt Heyer Ministries

item.title: Lord Bracton’s Rule of Law and the Trump’s Conviction [God, Law, and Liberty]
item.description: The conviction of former President Donald Trump generated lots of comments about the rule of law. Some said it was the end of the rule of law and others said it was demonstrative of the rule of law. What if neither observation is correct? David uses the thoughts of Lord Henry deBracton, the father of the common law, to examine rule of law and in what sense, if any, it exists today.

item.title: They Lied, Many Died: GLOBALIST MEDICAL TYRANNY & OUR DYSTOPIAN FUTURE [Liberty Dispatch]
item.description:
Liberty Dispatch ~ June 06, 2024
On this episode of Liberty Dispatch, Andrew and Matty deep-dive into a smorgasbord of recent COVID news. Our globalist elites destroyed the world, ruined lives, and killed people, and they want to be rewarded for their incompetence with more power. WE MUST NOT LET THEM!

Segment 1 - News Brief:
"Covid Vaccines May Have Helped Fuel Rise in Excess Deaths" | The Telegraph https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2024/06/04/covid-vaccines-may-have-helped-fuel-rise-in-excess-deaths;
"COVID-19 and Excess Mortality: Investigating the Role of Vaccination Policies" | Preprints https://www.preprints.org/manuscript/202403.0881/v1;
"Canadian Independent News Report" | Twitter https://x.com/canindependent/status/1793000520237384172;
"COVID-19: Impact on the Canadian Labour Market" | Statistics Canada https://www150.statcan.gc.ca/n1/pub/71-607-x/71-607-x2024004-eng.htm;
"COVID Vaccine Data and Reproductive Health" | OpenVAERS https://www.openvaers.com/covid-data/reproductive-health;
"Vaccine Mandates Likely Exacerbated Healthcare Worker Shortage, New Research Shows" | FEE https://fee.org/articles/vaccine-mandates-likely-exacerbated-healthcare-worker-shortage-new-research-shows;


Segment 2 - Interview with Dr. Voddie Baucham:
"WHO Director Tedros: It's Time to Be More Aggressive in Pushing Back on Anti-Vaxxers" | LifeSiteNews https://www.lifesitenews.com/news/who-director-tedros-its-time-to-be-more-aggressive-in-pushing-back-on-anti-vaxxers;
"Everything Wrong with the WHO Pandemic Treaty: The UsforThem Briefing" | The Daily Sceptic https://dailysceptic.org/2024/05/07/everything-wrong-with-the-who-pandemic-treaty-the-usforthem-briefing;
"WHO Gears Up to Strengthen Pandemic Response, Ratify Global Health Policies" | Rebel News https://www.rebelnews.com/who_gears_up_to_strengthen_pandemic_response_ratify_global_health_policies;
"New COVID-19 'Flirt' Variant Raises Concerns" | CNN https://www.cnn.com/2024/05/23/health/kp2-covid-flirt-variant-wellness/index.html;

"Global Pandemic Treaty Could Be More Than a Year Away After Deadline Missed" | The Guardian https://www.theguardian.com/global-development/article/2024/may/29/global-pandemic-treaty-could-be-more-than-a-year-away-after-deadline-missed;

Segment 3 - The Pro-Death, Anti-Logic of Insane Woke Leftists:
"CRA Admits to $10 Billion in Pandemic Relief Sent to Ineligible Applicants" | Rebel News https://www.rebelnews.com/cra_admits_to_10_billion_in_pandemic_relief_sent_to_ineligible_applicants;

This week Greg sat down with Parker Brown & Nik Sloan in studio. The boys are hosts of the Watch Well Podcast, where they have their guest watch a movie, and then discuss it from a biblical world view. Greg was recently a guest on their podcast, and they discussed the movie Tombstone that he chose, the reason why believers should view entertainment with purpose, as well as talking favorite movies and actors. This was a fun one to record! Enjoy!

item.title: Tiananmen Massacre, Beijing Below Zero, Baby Denied Visa [China Compass]
item.description:
On this edition of China Compass I discuss the 35th Anniversary of the Tiananmen Square massacre (1:40). Then I give my first and favorite impressions of Beijing (14:50), telling some of my favorite stories from the Chinese capital, including the miracle of getting my son’s very first visa. Finally, a little Q&A, focusing on cultural questions (33:59).

Pray for China, focusing this week on Beijing! We have missionary friends there who covet your prayers for their family: www.PrayforChina.us

Tiananmen links:

https://bitterwinter.org/thirty-years-after-tiananmen-and-religion/

https://www.charismanews.com/opinion/30-years-later-what-christians-should-know-about-china-s-horrific-tiananmen-square-massacre/

https://www.nytimes.com/1999/04/11/magazine/the-pilgrimage-from-tiananmen-square.html

And lots of shocking details here…

https://factsanddetails.com/china/cat2/sub7/entry-7461.html

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1989_Tiananmen_Square_protests_and_massacre

The very helpful and fascinating Chai Ling biography I referenced…

A Heart for Freedom: The Remarkable Journey of a Young Dissident, Her Daring Escape, and Her Quest to Free China's Daughters https://a.co/d/0KWT3ca

Finally, the dragon article I mentioned in the Q&A…

https://www.amnh.org/exhibitions/mythic-creatures/dragons/asian-dragons

item.title: Ep. 103: Voddie Baucham on Pride: It's Not Like Being Black [The Outstanding Podcast]
item.description:
We must speak the truth in love. May we never redefine love as not speaking truth. Host Joseph Backholm is joined by Voddie Baucham, former pastor and author of It’s Not Like Being Black for a discussion about Pride Month and race. When we accept the pride agenda, we are moving people further and further away from the truth. Many churches have embraced the sexual revolution, same-sex marriage, and transgenderism. Voddie offers insights on how to speak truth in love, the irony of the pride progress flag, and how Christians should think about hegemonic power. Listen now for tips on ways you can navigate Pride Month through a biblical worldview.

Resources

    • ⁠Voddie Baucham Ministries⁠

 

Read ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠The Washington Stand⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠, featuring news and commentary from a biblical worldview. Published by ⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠Family Research Council⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠⁠.

item.title: TCND: Guest or Friend, Suffering Well (Tabby's Havin' a Baby!) [The Comedian Next Door]
item.description:
We have a special Someone at the table today--though we can't decide whether he's a "guest" or a "friend."  One thing we DO know for sure is, we are pretty slap-happy to have a few days with Juan DeVevo...

Did you know disc golf brands like to NAME the various discs? Usually they come with names like "Punisher" or "Intimidater."  But Juan wants to market a line of more peaceful-sounding discs.

Next: Tabby is in labor! Thus sayeth The Doula (though she really isn't qualified to say much else)...

Then: What happens when an Atheist rejects religion and insists there's no such thing as evil, but then she experiences tremendous evil perpetuated against HERSELF?  (Spoiler: they do NOT suffer well.)

Email the Comedian's family at nextdoor@johnbranyan.com
item.author: FLF, LLC
item.itunes:author: FLF, LLC

item.title: How To Win The World, Episode 1: Believe It's Winnable, With Josh Howard [The Rebel Podcast]
item.description:
The Ezra Institute brings you a new series with the Rebels when P Nate and Pootie are joined by a variety of guests talking about several key practical outworkings of theological concepts that will help Christians expand the Kingdom of God, see the dark pushed back and slowly (like leaven working through the loaf) win the world.
 
This episode P Nate is joined by pastor/ author Josh Howard, who hosts the Eschatology Matters podcast, to discuss step one to saving the world... believing this world can actually be won!
item.author: Pastors Nate & Chris - The Rebels
item.itunes:author: Pastors Nate & Chris - The Rebels

item.title: A Look at the Sacraments [The Pugcast]
item.description:
On today's show the Pugsters consider the definitions of sacraments vs. ordinances before taking a closer look at baptism and the Lord’s Supper. They spend some time on the less discussed images of baptism in the New Testament (the Flood and the Exodus) and the use of the Greek word baptizo in the Septuagint. They then talk about the Lord’s Supper, noting the use of the phrase “body of Christ” in 1 Corinthians and both the vertical and horizontal dimensions of the Supper.

 

Support the Pugcast on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/thetheologypugcast?fbclid=IwAR17UHhfzjphO52C_kkZfursA_C784t0ldFix0wyB4fd-YOJpmOQ3dyqGf8

 

The Theology Pugcast is a ministry of Trinity Reformed Church in Huntsville Alabama. To view more media from TRC, visit their website: https://trinityreformedkirk.com/trc-media/
